text: How was your day Mr christian?

I have a few more questions 

What are the biggest technological changes influencing your job area/sector right now?
Has anything surprised you over the course of your career? What changes have you found most challenging?
What do you think of 'Law' as a career? Do you think its worth the time and effort?
Could there be any upcoming changes to the 'law' job area/ sector in terms of technological development?

And.. 
'You mentioned English could also be a career I could think about' What are the pros and cons in this career sector?
No trouble - sorry I haven;t been so engaged recently, had a very intense couple of weeks at work

What are the biggest technological changes influencing your job area/sector right now?: in terms of my dispute work, we had some cases recently in which data on transactions entered into by our clients was needed, but the system on which they were recorded were old and didn;t speak to each other - new systems that are in place are much more connected, and so the technical data that we need for our work is much more accessible. but most of the  of the changes in my sector have been economic and commercial rather than tech driven,

Has anything surprised you over the course of your career? What changes have you found most challenging?: I;ve won some cases where that has surprised me! I've been lucky to always (i think) been on the right side of disputes, in that i am always convinced that there really is a case to be made. But that doesn;t always mean you;re likely to win, so sometimes it is a pleasant surprise!

the changes that have been the most challenging - in terms of career, going from doing analysis to actually writing expert witness reports to be submitted to tribunals - that was a big challenge. In terms of the sector as a whole, i don;t think i;ve really seen changes as challenges, so not got a good answer there i'm afraid

What do you think of 'Law' as a career? Do you think its worth the time and effort?; Law is a very interesting choice if you like careful argument, and there will always be a demand for lawyers! there are chances to do lots of interesting things (and earn lots of money if that's your thing), I am actually thinking about retraining as a lawyer at some point. But, the flip side is that it is very hard work as a trainee lawyer - long long hours of boring work to get through before you get to do the interesting stuff!

Could there be any upcoming changes to the 'law' job area/ sector in terms of technological development?: good question, the truth is I don't know. I guess there will be interesting legal elements to work out as AI becomes better developed, but in terms of the legal work itself, i just can;t say

'You mentioned English could also be a career I could think about' What are the pros and cons in this career sector?: I may have said english as a degree rather than career. The ability to read and understand text is a very important one, transfers to a lot of disciplines. Law is one, my job is another. So from that perspective, it is a useful degree. On the other hand, we unfortunately live in a world where "hard" degrees like maths, science etc are seen as "useful" and "soft" degrees like english, history, philosophy etc are seen as weaker and less useful. That couldn;t be more wrong, but is a fact of our modern society. That's something to think about in terms of picking a degree whilst looking at future career paths.

as i said, i;ve had an intense time at work. I was put on a project in a completely different area than I'm used to, so I had a lot to learn and get up to speed on so that I could get a report written for our client this week. Lots of new knowledge, and built an analytical tool for others in the office to use, so hard work but very useful! At the same time, been building an economic model for a corruption case, trying to work out what the market value of a contract was in 2010. Also very interesting! But lots of work, so apologies again for being quiet.
Coming up to the end of the program, I hope you've found it useful, and happy to answer any more last minute questions you might have!

Thank you so much!!! Youve been incredibly informative and very helpful. 

Most of all my questions are answered and I feel more confident about what I will do in the future and its all thanks to you. I am in a way better position than I was before I started this Prospela Programme.
I'll let you know if I have any more last minute questions. Thank you so much for your help.
Great, glad to have helped! Good luck with whatever it is that you choose to do!
